page.title: 13Education
page.content: There is no playschool in our area but most pre-school children can go to Cupar or Gauldry kindergartens. Four year old pre-school children come to Rathillet school once a week for two hours to get used to the school. The pupils from Logie and Kilmany now attend Rathillet school because Logie closed in 1970 and Kilmany in 1981. Even though most of the pupils live within two miles they get ferried to school by mini-bus because the main road is so busy.Pupils living at Ballindean and Fincraigs attend Gauldry school and later Madras College in St.Andrews for secondary education.When the pupils finish primary 7 here they go up to Bell-Baxter High school in Cupar.
